Referring to Platform Core for comment and/or investigation.

Note that IResource.PROJECT is not a valid flag for the delete method.  Look at
the API for IResource.delete to see what flags are valid.

Deletion can fail for various reasons.  We cannot diagnose the reason because
the java.io deletion native just returns a boolean result.  Here are some
possible reasons why delete may fail:

- Disk is not accessible
- You don't have the appropriate permission in the file system
- Another application currently has an open file handle in that directory
- An eclipse plugin has changed the working directory of the current VM to a
directory inside where the deletion is taking place.

You'll have to investigate further at your end before we can help any further. 
For example, see what files are failing to delete, and look at what plugins may
have recently operated on those files.  If individual files are failing to
delete, you can try IFile.getLocation().toFile().delete() to see if that
succeeds.  Let us know what you discover.

Is it only the .project file that fails to delete?  Look in the file system
after the delete fails and see what files are there.

In 2.0, when move failed, the destination was sometimes left out of sync with
the file system.  This means what you see in Eclipse may not reflect what has
happened on disk.

Is it reproducible with different VMs?  You might want to try IBM JRE, J9SC, and
a Sun JRE to see if it happens in all cases. Another question: is it
reproducible on another machine?  It could possibly be a hardware or disk problem.

It is .project file and project folder fails during the project delete 
operation. 
I am using the JVM shipped with WSADIE5.0 with the build mentioned earlier.
Also I tried with sun JRE VM (j2re1.4.1_02) which gives the same result.

Step to recreate the problem:
Create your own Treeview.
Create your own resource types for project folder and file which are 
IAdaptables.
Create the wizards for project creation.
Create actions for project creation and deletion.
Include the actions in the tree context menu of your own view(which is created 
earlier).
Create the project in the view.
Delete the project in the view.

Closing since the problem seems to be in the user's code and not in the plug-
ins which are distributed with the Eclipse SDK based on:
- project deletion works ok in Navigator
- project deletion works ok in Packages View
- project deletion only fails in user created view
- log file contains entries for Rational/IBM plug-ins but no Eclipse plug-ins
